Comment: I’m far from a fan of Trump or the means that he is using but let’s reserve judgment here until the facts are in. The tell will be if the CG conducts non-judicial or court martial proceedings against the service member. Keep in mind too that aside from the relevant immigration issues, marriage and the lower enlisted ranks are not a good combination.
Author: RedditReader4031

Comment: Yours is a valid sentiment but ignores the broadest possible picture. There is and always has been a certain level of convenience marriages in the military. Sometimes to permit the immigrant spouse to gain citizenship. Sometimes to allow the military member to gain better quarters - single’s often are assigned to a barracks, this is a way to get base family style housing. All cases deserve scrutiny. In 1957, my parents had to seek the approval of my dad’s Commanding Officer to get married. When I served in the late 70’s, COs stopped a lot of overseas arrangements.
Author: RedditReader4031

Comment: Are you saying non-judicial vs court martial in that the latter more “an attack” while the former would be a pre-2025, business as usual response?  I’m inclined to agree with you. But I have seen a number of court martials for lying on an official document or to an official — in the CG specifically. Many of those ‘charges’ usually stemming from the investigation of a bigger, more serious incident but not always. I only say that to offer some hope that if it does go to UCMJ, maybe it’s not political.  Note: I’m assuming you mentioned punishment because of the requirement to report foreign contacts (during clearance investigations or maybe other military screenings). But it’s been a long time since I read the UCMJ and won’t pretend I have a clue on what (else) could be thrown at this guy.  ETA: clarified the note section.
